artciles.q: What is weir?
option: a low dam built across a river
artciles.answer: a low dam built across a river

artciles.q: find the odd one
How are the weirs classified?
Where is broad crested weir is used?
option: to measure open channel flow rate
artciles.answer: to measure open channel flow rate

artciles.q: Does the magnitude of the flow rate affect the discharge coefficient Cod?
Cod will ________ with increasing flow rate
find the odd ?
Would you expect the length of the weir crest to affect the discharge coefficient Cod?
Not  a advantage of using weirs
How many types of weirs are there based on the shape of the crest?
artciles.description: The four types are sharp-crested, broad-crested, narrow-crested and ogee-shaped weir.

artciles.q: _________ weir comprises several designs into one structure.
artciles.description: Compound weirs are commonly seen in locations where a river has multiple users who may need to bypass the structure. Common design includes a broad-crested weir.

artciles.q: Triangular weir is also called:
artciles.description: Triangular weir is shaped like a reverse triangle that is the shape of V. Hence, it is also called V-notch weir. These can be used to measure discharge over small flows with greater accuracy.

artciles.q: Head loss will be small in case of:
artciles.description: Broad crested weirs are constructed in rectangular shape only and are suitable for larger flows. Hence, head loss is less.

artciles.q: in trapezoidal weir, sides are inclined outward with a slope of:
artciles.description: In trapezoidal weir, the sides are sloping outward at a specific inclination of 1:4 (horizontal: vertical). It is a modification of rectangular weir with slightly higher capacity.

artciles.q: Weirs are normally used to calculate:
artciles.description: Discharge or flow rate is measured and calculated by analysing a weir. It is given by Q=CLHn, where C is flow coefficient, L is width of crest, H is height of head, n is different for different structures.

artciles.q: ________ is the standard shape of a weir.
artciles.description: Rectangular is the standard shape of a weir. Triangular and trapezoidal weirs are modifications of it. They are generally suitable for larger flowing channels.

artciles.q: Cippoletti weir has ___________ slope:
artciles.description: Cippoletti weir is a special case of a trapezoidal weir. In this, the side slope on either sides are equal. So, trapezoid can be divided into rectangular and triangular portion and hence analysed easily.

artciles.q: The overflowing sheet of water is called:
artciles.description: Nappe represents the overflowing sheet of water. If it discharges into air, it is free discharge. If discharge is partly under water, it is submerged/drowned discharge.

artciles.q: For a discharge of triangular weirs with notch angle __________ the formula is 0.685 h2.45.
artciles.description: or 30o angle, the formula is 0.685 h2.45. For 60o angle, it is 1.45 h2.47 and for 90o angle, it is 2.49 h2.48.

artciles.q: Which of the below is suitable for soft sandy foundation?
artciles.description: Masonry or concrete slope weir is the one suitable for soft sandy foundation. It is used where difference in weir crest and downstream river is limited to 3m.

artciles.q: Weirs can be used to power water wheels and power sawmills.
artciles.description: Mill ponds are created by a weir. It impounds water and then it flows over the structure. The energy created by this change in height of the water is used to power watermills and sawmills.

artciles.q: Trapezoidal weir has another popular name. What is it?
artciles.description: Trapezoidal weir is also called Cipolletti weir.

artciles.q: baffel used for to allow  __________ flow of water
The weir is an attachable structure made up of thermoplastic.
The notch is bigger in size than wier
artciles.description: The weir is bigger in size than notch.
